ratings.comment: He is very arrogant, rude, and acts like a know-it-all. Lecture is pointless and not necessary for the papers or final. He lists a bunch of history that you're never tested on, but it's interesting. My TA was great, but graded harsh. Interesting stories in the anthology. One of the books we were required to buy we never used. We watched Avatar!

A big tip for this class would be to take your book to lecture and use a highlighter/pencil to underline every quote that he brings up from the stories. This will be highly important to know these quotes for the final. Overall, the lecture was disorganized. The essay questions are very hard.

My main issue was that this class was poorly structured. The final is a literature final (on an anthology with over 100 stories), but the lectures are all history. If you are avidly interested in Native lit/history, the guy will love you. If you're only there for the ethnic studies requirement (like I was), his attitude will probably irritate you.

This class was very interesting an one that I really enjoyed throughout the semester. He teaches things that most people don't know. HOWEVER, lectures are completey useless because the entire final is based off an 800 page anthology you read throughout the semester. Worth taking for interesting history, not for an easy grade.

Pompous ass who is overly strict and results in many distractions.  Very unclear about what was going to be on the final until 3 weeks before it.  Lecture is sort of pointless. Learn a lot about the depressing side of NA culture and white guilt, and basically non about their modern day culture
The points Teuton discusses in class have really nothing to do with the final.  Teuton comes off as very arrogant and it is very distracting making it difficult to get anything out of the class.

I took this class for my ethnic studies credit, expecting it to be an interesting class. The material itself is very interesting. However, Prof. Teuton is extremely enthusiastic about the subject, and this is where the problem lies. His personal opinions get in the way of teaching literature analysis. Lecture usually doesn't apply to the final.

Prof. Teuton was the greatest professor/ human being i have ever met. he helped me to get off drugs and straighten my life out. he talked to me when nobody else would. he really is a great prof. because he taught great material and always listens to the opinions of others. great novels were assigned as well and he always led interesting lectures.

He can seem arrogant and very uptight BUT he really knows his stuff and his knowledge is going toward a good cause. He makes some ridiculous rules in his class and might raise his voice some but i think its only because its such a large lecture. He assigns great books. The novels and biographies are fascinating. Overall, a great class and good guy.

Professor Teuton's lectures were pretty interesting.  He presented information in ways that I may not have considered previously.  Sometimes his opinions did seem stubborn, but I think he is just passionate about what he is teaching.  I definitely learned a lot in this class- more so about Native Americans than english, but I had expected that.

In 7 semesters at UW this is my least favorite class.  Boring lecture, ridiculous and confusing essays, and the grading was all based on TAs.  I got my lowest grade of college despite reading and attending every lecture.  The prof presented his very skewed opinion as fact, and if you have an alternate view you will be wrong.  This class does NOT make you think, it forces HIS opinion down your throat!  Avoid.
This professor is arrogant, unclear and boring. He teaches literature without open to interpretation. This class assumes no pre-requisite but it expects too much, especially from freshmen.
Great Professor.  Very engaged in subject matter.  If you read everything assigned and engage in the discussion, you can get alot out of this class and more than likely earn an A to a B.

Professor Teuton is my favorite professor this semester. I don't understand the prior negative comments, but Professor Teuton's class is extremely interesting and makes you think. The novels you read are actually really good and definitely worth reading. The class isn't easy, but I read the books and studied for the exam and did very well.

If you take this class, be prepared to sit through fifty minutes of a guilt trip every time you go to lecture. The topic has the potential to be interesting but you end up leaving with a false impression that the culture is nothing but hostile.  He blames the students for any negative events of Native American history. HORRIBLE PROFESSOR!!!

"To Natives, the past is not a function of time; rather it is a function of place."  If you're ready to put up with an entire semester of inane, faux-intellectual drivel like this, you get an easy ethnic studies requirement.  If you planned on learning anything about Native American Literature beyond White Guilt, you'll be disappointed.

RECOMMENDED FOR ETHNIC STUDIES REQ! Very interesting speaker. Not necessarily the most interesting lectures, but his speaking style is very enjoyable. The exams were ridiculously easy because he provides essay prompts ahead of time. The 1st paper is really easy, and the 2nd is a little more challenging. The books are (with 1 exception) very good.
easy but boring class. good for meeting the ethnic requirement, but nothing else.

I really like the class but I hate this guy as a professor.  To me he tries to act like he is sophisticated where as other professors at least make an effort to relate to the students. He is obviously well-studied in the area but is a little bit to opinionated and bias, which makes it hard for anyone whose views differ from his to pay attention.

A very easy way to fufill a lit and ethnic requirement. I didn't have to read any of the books, because the exams just consist of spitting back what he's told you about them in lecture. Make sure you have a good TA tho. Mine gave out review sheets and discussed the books in depth in discussion, so again, I didn't have to read them. good deal.

I didn't read any of the books and I got an A. Just go to lecture and take very good notes. The exams are basically spitting back lecture. The papers are annoying, but the second one is graded fairly. Lecture can be painful to listen to at times because some of Teuton's ideas are "out there", but you do gain some insight to Native culture.

Don't listen to previous comments on this class being hard! The 1st paper (only 15% of your grade!) was harsh, that is true, but all of these comments were written out of anger right after this paper. Everything past the paper was VERY easy and even with a C on that first paper, I still got an A in the class..some of the books were really good too!

i think the class was extremely interesting and i learned  a lot, idk why ppl degrade him.. but yes his essay questions were very vague and poorly worded, and even tested on things that were more or less his opinion - but at least u get to see them ahead of time.. will be easy if ur already good with literuture/writing but quite hard if ur not

Its easy but not worth it because its so overly politically correct and teaches you nothing you do not already know about colonization. They make you memorize dates too. Also a lot of double standards and he does not encourage critical thinking, but rather, agreeing with his opinion, which he presents as fact.

The professor himself was a very nice, easy to talk to man. His important points are clearly defined in powerpt. notes, but he is unclear otherwise as to what he wants you to know. The TAs, while nice, are pretty awful...rediculous paper/essay test graders.  NOT RECCOMENDED!

don't take this class! the easiness depends on your TA, mine grades ridiculously hard which I feel is a little extreme in a 100 level class. Prof. Teuton is terribly boring, although he may be a nice guy I think he's an awful teacher. I wish I wouldn't have taken this class so I definitely don't recommend it.

He's a really nice and interesting guy face to face, like other people have said, but it seems like he gets nervous in front of a class of a couple hundred. Lectures were unclear and all over the place at the beginning of the semester, but it seems like his lectures are getting progressively better. Lots of reading...

lectures are interesting if u read the books. the class has no surprises. he gives u the essay questions before the exam. teuton seems like he is arrogant, but if u talk to him he is a really nice guy and is interested in keepin everybody interested. i would recommend the class.

He seemed like a nice guy, but his lectures were incredibly boring.  He is very interesting face to face as I learned from office hours, but in a large lecture hall he just seems to drone on and on about the same exact points every single lecture.  I would recommend him for a small discussion, but not a large lecture.

like other reviews say, he beats the same few points of native american equality to death (not that they aren't important) and i often heard him called professor ****bag because he's a bit anal, but i think he means well and although i did not like him or the class i think interested parties would very much like him

Sean taught me in a 20ish person discussion.  The class was challenging, stimulating and Sean was an excellent d.j. to our class discussions and a truly sincere person who cared about each of his students.  Thank you Professor Teuton for a job well done.
He repeats his points, but makes it easier to understand what he wants from us. It is always interesting to learn from someone so excited about what he is teaching

Native American Literature a very easy class.  Reading can be boring, but not too bad.  He is the most overly PC teacher I've ever had, and he seems to make the same point every lecture, and that is Indian culture changes, and white men did evil unforgivable things to them.  He does have good TA's though.

A very easy class, but the lectures are extremely boring.  The professor seems to only want to make one point about all of Native American culture and he repeats it several times in each lecture.  There is a lot of reading, but most of it is fairly interesting.  Overall an easy, but boring class.
Made great insight into topic, gave you a view into the Native American world.  PC only because people dont understand.  Easy class too, I got a 100 on the exam.

He taught absolutely nothing and his tests had the worst questions. There was a lot of reading and he was the whiniest most overly politically correct professor I've ever had. The TAs were even worse...Gave poor grades for disagreeing with their opinions.
